jaicore.graphvisualizer.gui

Class Recorder<V,E>

  • java.lang.Object
    • jaicore.graphvisualizer.gui.Recorder<V,E>

  • public class Recorder<V,E>
extends java.lang.Object
    A recorder class, which is used to record GraphEvents. These graphevents are usually created by a search-algorithm. If is possible to store the recorded events in a file and later load them from one. The recorder is controlled by controll-events.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Recorder()
      A constructor for an empty recorder.
      Recorder(jaicore.graph.IGraphAlgorithm<?,?,V,E> algorithm)
      Creates a recorder which listens to an algorithm.

      Receive a nodePushedEvent and expand the node, does not matter where the search currently is

    • Constructor Detail

      • Recorder

        public Recorder()
        A constructor for an empty recorder. The empty recorder does not listen to an algorithm but it can load a replay.

      • Recorder

        public Recorder(jaicore.graph.IGraphAlgorithm<?,?,V,E> algorithm)
        Creates a recorder which listens to an algorithm.
        Parameters:
        algorithm - The algorithm from which the reocrder receives the events.

    • Method Detail

      • registerReplayListener

        public void registerReplayListener(java.lang.Object listener)
        Register a listener to the replay-Eventbus to receive the graphevents, that are outgoing of the recorder.
        Parameters:
        listener - The listener, which is going to receive the graph-Events.

      • registerInfoListener

        public void registerInfoListener(java.lang.Object listener)
        Register a listener to the info-Eventbus to receive general information of the state of the replay and recorder. Such information are for example the number of received events.
        Parameters:
        listener - The listener, which is going to receive the Info-Events.

      • receiveGraphEvent

        public void receiveGraphEvent(GraphEvent event)
        This method is used to receive GraphEvents
        Parameters:
        event -

      • receiveControlEvent

        Receive a control event and make the appropiate action
        Parameters:
        event -

      • counterEvent

        public java.lang.Object counterEvent(java.lang.Object event)
        Creates a counterevent to the event which was given. Currently the events which can be countered are most of the graphevents
        Parameters:
        event - The event to which a counter event should be created
        Returns:
        The counter event

      • addDataSupplier

        public void addDataSupplier(ISupplier iSupplier)
        Adds a new Datasupplier to the recorder. The datasupplier it self is registered at the replaybus to get graphevents from the recorder.
        Parameters:
        iSupplier -

      • getSupplier

        public void getSupplier()
        Posts every known DataSupplier as an addSupplierevent on the InfoBus
